JobFullDesc: At Raytheon Missiles & Defense, fresh thinking and possibilities are forged in times of change and you will be on the front lines as we trailblaze new approaches, push the boundaries of innovation and chart a course to a tomorrow you can be proud to have a hand in creating.Industrial Engineers apply advanced problem solving techniques and lean principles to develop and optimize the Manufacturing system in order to maximize throughput, increase efficiency and value. Industrial Engineers are involved in all phases of the factory life cycle, including proposals, Capacity Planning, Manpower Planning, Factory Layout, Cell/Line balancing, Simulation and Process Modeling, Labor Performance Analysis, Pareto Analysis, Process Mapping, and Project Management.Responsibilities to Anticipate: Identify throughput constraints by performing capacity, simulation, what-if scenario analysis.Drive factory improvement project priorities through the use of analytical tools.Coordinate factory capability needs for yield improvements and new technology.Support factory development through project justification, design and implementation.Identify and participate in improvement projects to support constraint elimination.Identify and participate in Safety and Ergonomic improvements.Apply Six Sigma and Lean Principles to include the use of value stream maps, line balancing, and error proofing. Support manufacturing objectives for cost, quality, on time delivery and safety.Support the 5-Year Strategic Roadmap development and maintenance.Develop strategic plan for factory space, manpower, equipment and automation.Coordinate factory and process life-cycle optimization.Support bids, proposals, and Make/Buy/Where analysis.This position can be Industrial Engineer I or Industrial Engineer II depending on the candidate's qualifications as they relate to the skills, experience and responsibility requirements for the position.An advanced degree in a related field may be substituted for 2 additional years of experience.Qualifications You Must Have:Industrial Engineer IBachelor’s Degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) Preferred Degrees include: Industrial Engineering or Systems EngineeringExperience/Education with Industrial Engineering Acumen (Lean Manufacturing, Simulation Modeling, Constraint Analysis)Ability to obtain and maintain a US security clearance prior to the start date.
